title: How to Make the Sims 3 Hunger Games

steps.headline: Create 8 young adult sims; 4 females and 4 Males.
Give the characters creative names such as Maple and Columbine.
Put them in the same clothes or clothing that are similar.
Give the Sims traits that will or will not help them in the arena such as Angler, Green thumb, Hates the Outdoors, and Neurotic.
Understand that a Training Arena is optional, but highly recommended if you want to gain skills such as the athletic skill or the Fishing skill.
steps.description: Creating a training arena can  also help build relationships like love, friendship, and enemies.

steps.headline: Build a very fancy or high-tech building with good quality beds, toilets, etc.
Get a very large lot.

steps.headline: Make any type of arena you what to make (a city of ruins, a forest, or a bunch of islands)
Make sure there are a few buildings, even if you do make a forest one because the trees provide no shade.
Add a bathroom building with a toilet, sink, and bath.
Add a building with one twin bed, 2 benches, and a few pictures if you want.
Add a pond, a few plants, a fire pit, and random pieces of fruit, herbs, and vegetables and scatter all of these randomly and well hidden.
Make multiple death possibilities so it's not going to be be the same thing over and over again.
Add a pool.
steps.description: Sims are pretty stupid, so, even when they are really close to death, they will want to swim for fun.

text:
Creating the Characters Create 8 young adult sims; 4 females and 4 Males. Give the characters creative names such as Maple and Columbine. Put them in the same clothes or clothing that are similar. Give the Sims traits that will or will not help them in the arena such as Angler, Green thumb, Hates the Outdoors, and Neurotic. Creating the Training Arena Understand that a Training Arena is optional, but highly recommended if you want to gain skills such as the athletic skill or the Fishing skill. Creating a training arena can also help build relationships like love, friendship, and enemies. Build a very fancy or high-tech building with good quality beds, toilets, etc. Make 4 bedrooms for your sims; have 2 sims per room. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add a kitchen, dining room, and living room. 3. add a training area so put in tons of exercise equipment 4. in the backyard area put in a pool, a pond, a garden area and whatever else may help you sims gain skills such as a bookcase. (adding a training area can practically make the game more interesting and more realistic){"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Creating the Arena Get a very large lot. If you had a training arena, have all of them move to this lot. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make any type of arena you what to make (a city of ruins, a forest, or a bunch of islands) Make sure there are a few buildings, even if you do make a forest one because the trees provide no shade. Add a bathroom building with a toilet, sink, and bath. Add a building with one twin bed, 2 benches, and a few pictures if you want. Add a pond, a few plants, a fire pit, and random pieces of fruit, herbs, and vegetables and scatter all of these randomly and well hidden. Make multiple death possibilities so it's not going to be be the same thing over and over again. Add a pool. Sims are pretty stupid, so, even when they are really close to death, they will want to swim for fun. Add a magic jelly bean bush (supernatural). They will love to try a jelly bean since they become so desperate and maybe one will kill them. Other ways that they may die are starvation, catching on fire, etc. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Playing the Game with Your Sims Keep in mind that you can not help Sims win or lose in this game; you can only sit and watch what happens. Once all the Sims are in the arena, put a closed fence in so the Sims can't leave, order pizza, or something like that. Watch and enjoy. When there is only one Sim left, declare them winner. Eventually, after 7 other hunger games, have the winners face each other in a Quarter Quell. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-18Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-18Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-18Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-18Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons

sentences: Creating the Characters Create 8 young adult sims; 4 females and 4 Males.
Give the characters creative names such as Maple and Columbine.
Put them in the same clothes or clothing that are similar.
Give the Sims traits that will or will not help them in the arena such as Angler, Green thumb, Hates the Outdoors, and Neurotic.
Creating the Training Arena Understand that a Training Arena is optional, but highly recommended if you want to gain skills such as the athletic skill or the Fishing skill.
Creating a training arena can  also help build relationships like love, friendship, and enemies.
Build a very fancy or high-tech building with good quality beds, toilets, etc.
Make 4 bedrooms for your sims; have 2 sims per room.

3. add a training area so put in tons of exercise equipment 4. in the backyard area put in a pool, a pond, a garden area and whatever else may help you sims gain skills such as a bookcase.

(adding a training area can practically make the game more interesting and more realistic){"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/14\/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/14\/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Creating the Arena Get a very large lot.
If you had a training arena, have all of them move to this lot.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1c\/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/1c\/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Make any type of arena you what to make (a city of ruins, a forest, or a bunch of islands) Make sure there are a few buildings, even if you do make a forest one because the trees provide no shade.
Add a bathroom building with a toilet, sink, and bath.
Add a building with one twin bed, 2 benches, and a few pictures if you want.
Add a pond, a few plants, a fire pit, and random pieces of fruit, herbs, and vegetables and scatter all of these randomly and well hidden.
Make multiple death possibilities so it's not going to be be the same thing over and over again.
Add a pool.
Sims are pretty stupid, so, even when they are really close to death, they will want to swim for fun.
Add a magic jelly bean bush (supernatural).
They will love to try a jelly bean since they become so desperate and maybe one will kill them.
Other ways that they may die are starvation, catching on fire, etc.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-the-Sims-3-Hunger-Games-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":288,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":475,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Playing the Game with Your Sims Keep in mind that you can not help Sims win or lose in this game; you can only sit and watch what happens.
Once all the Sims are in the arena, put a closed fence in so the Sims can't leave, order pizza, or something like that.
Watch and enjoy.
When there is only one Sim left, declare them winner.
Eventually, after 7 other hunger games, have the winners face each other in a Quarter Quell.
